item.title: Tmux Cheat sheet
item.description: tmux is a terminal multiplexer for Unix-like operating systems. It allows multiple terminal sessions to be accessed simultaneously in a single window. It is useful for running more than one command-line program at the same time. tmux shortcuts & cheatsheet start new: tmux start new with session name: tmux new -s myname attach: tmux a # (or at, or attach) attach to named: tmux a -t myname list sessions:

item.title: Golang Cheat Sheet
item.description: Index Index Credits Go in a Nutshell Basic Syntax Hello World Operators Arithmetic Comparison Logical Other Declarations Functions Functions As Values And Closures Variadic Functions Built-in Types Type Conversions Packages Control structures If Loops Switch Arrays, Slices, Ranges Arrays Slices Operations on Arrays and Slices Maps Structs Pointers Interfaces Embedding Errors Concurrency Goroutines Channels Channel Axioms Printing Reflection Type Switch Snippets HTTP Server Credits Most example code taken from A Tour of Go, which is an excellent introduction to Go.

item.title: Modern Javascript Cheat Sheet
item.description: Modern JavaScript Cheatsheet Image Credits: Ahmad Awais ⚡️ Introduction Motivation This document is a cheatsheet for JavaScript you will frequently encounter in modern projects and most contemporary sample code. This guide is not intended to teach you JavaScript from the ground up, but to help developers with basic knowledge who may struggle to get familiar with modern codebases (or let’s say to learn React for instance) because of the JavaScript concepts used.
